botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Ingestion may cause severe discomfort, sap can also cause skin irritation (contact dermatitis). Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Narcissus are bulbous herbaceous perennials with linear leaves and leafless stems bearing flowers, which may be solitary or in umbels, with 6 spreading perianth segments and a cup or trumpet-shaped corona
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Tazetta daffodils have relatively broad leaves, and stems bearing umbels of up to 20, usually fragrant flowers per stem, fewer in larger-flowered cultivars

how_to_grow.cultivation: Plant bulb at one to two times its own depth. This cultivar needs a warm sunny spot in light soil to perform best.
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by removing offsets as the leaves fade in the summer
how_to_grow.pruning: Deadhead as flowers fade and allow the leaves to die down naturally
how_to_grow.pests: May be attacked by slugs, narcissus bulb fly, narcissus eelworm, and bulb scale mite.
